page.title: 17Mrs Hazeldine of Ranton
page.content: Mrs Hazeldine was born in Wolverhampton and used to be a police sergeant. When she was in the police force she met her husband and left to get married. Soon afterwards they bought the Hand and Cleaver Inn. They also kept pigs and cattle and bred cockerels. They sold the pigs and cockerels and just kept the cows to keep the grass down. They sold the inn after twenty-one years and were glad to retire. The Hazeldines kept some of the inn's land as it joined on to the farm they had bought. Unfortunately no farming is done but the thirty acres are rented out for summer grazing. It is rented out from May to October for Friesian cattle.
